newsitem.title: AUSTRALIA: Costello says labour productivity may be better.
newsitem.headline: Costello says labour productivity may be better.

text.p: Australian Treasurer Peter Costello said on Thursday labour productivity may be better than expected over 1997.
"Labour productivity could be much better than we thought and prospects could be much better than we thought over the course of 1997," Costello told an economic society conference.
He had been asked if the Reserve Bank of Australia's target of keeping wage growth below 4.5 percent was too high.
Costello said the RBA's wages target had two components labour productivity and inflation and that labour producitivity might be better than earlier expected.

The Reserve Bank aims to keep underlying inflation between two and three percent over the course of a business cycle. Annual underlying inflation was 1.7 percent in the June quarer, the lowest level since records started in 1971.
